qas.question: What was another name for Blackbeard?
What was the name of blackbeards ship?
Where in North Carolina did Blackbeards ship crash?
What year did Blackbeard run his ship aground in North Carolina?
What year were the remains of the Queen Anne's Revenge discovered?

context: In June <a3_0>1718<a3_0/> Blackbeard, aka <a0_0>Edward Teach<a0_0/>, ran his flagship, <a1_0>the Queen Anne's Revenge<a1_0/>, aground at <a2_0>Beaufort Inlet<a2_0/>, North Carolina, in present-day Carteret County. After the grounding her crew and supplies were transferred to smaller ships. In <a4_0>1996<a4_0/> Intersal, Inc., a private firm, discovered the remains of a vessel likely to be the Queen Anne's Revenge, which was added to the US National Register of Historic Places. In November, after losing his ship and appealing to the governor of North Carolina who promised safe-haven and a pardon, the notorious pirate, Blackbeard (Edward Teach) was killed in an ambush by troops from Virginia.
